column4: BRIEF-Microsoft says Microsoft Teams is now generally available in 181 markets and in 19 languages

column4: Reuters Select: The optics of Intel's Mobileye acquisition
column5: Intel is paying more than $15 billion to get into direct competition with Nvidia and Qualcomm to develop driverless systems for automakers. And  as Reuters' Tova Cohen  Ari Rabinovitch and Paul Lienert report  they're paying big to do it: 21 times Mobileye's expected 2017 revenue and 60 times earnings -- high valuations in just about any field  but certainly in this one. Find out why Intel thinks the cost is worth it.

column4: UPDATE 1-Connected or mechanical? TAG Heuer tries to bridge gap with module watch
column5: BRUNNEN  Switzerland  March 14 Swiss watchmaker TAG Heuer  owned by LVMH  sought to appeal to tech geeks and traditionalists alike on Tuesday by launching a connected watch that lets wearers switch between a smart watch head and a traditional mechanical movement.

column4: Israel eyes tax cuts as Intel-Mobileye deal to boost coffers by $1 billion
column5: JERUSALEM Israel's government will receive about 4 billion shekels ($1.1 billion) after Intel's  planned $15.3 billion purchase of self-driving car tech firm Mobileye   helping the government cut more taxes  Finance Minister Moshe Kahlon said on Tuesday.

column4: Israel eyes tax cuts as Intel-Mobileye deal to boost coffers by $1 bln
column5: JERUSALEM  March 14 Israel's government will receive about 4 billion shekels ($1.1 billion) after Intel's  planned $15.3 billion purchase of self-driving car tech firm Mobileye  helping the government cut more taxes  Finance Minister Moshe Kahlon said on Tuesday.

column4: Swiss watch demand improving thanks to China - LVMH watch head Biver
column5: BRUNNEN  Switzerland  March 14 Demand for Swiss watches has improved  driven by a rebound in Chinese purchases  the head of luxury group LVMH's watch business said on Tuesday.
